name: About Face

rulings.text: Note that the wording "Effects that alter the creature's power alter its toughness instead, and vice versa, this turn" has been removed.
Effects that switch power and toughness apply after all other effects that change power and/or toughness, regardless of which effect was created first.
Switching a creature's power and toughness twice (or any even number of times) effectively returns the creature to the power and toughness it had before any switches.

text: Switch target creature's power and toughness until end of turn.
originalText: Switch target creature's power and toughness until end of turn. Effects that alter the creature's power alter its toughness instead, and vice versa, this turn.
flavor: The overconfident are the most vulnerable.

name: Angel's Trumpet

rulings.text: Angel's Trumpet affects creatures with Defender and other creatures that can't attack for some reason.
It does not affect creatures which did not attack, but which are already tapped at the time the ability resolves.

text:
All creatures have vigilance.
At the beginning of each player's end step, tap all untapped creatures that player controls that didn't attack this turn. Angel's Trumpet deals damage to the player equal to the number of creatures tapped this way.
originalText:
Attacking does not cause creatures to tap.
At the end of each player's turn, tap all untapped creatures he or she controls that did not attack this turn. Angel's Trumpet deals 1 damage to that player for each creature tapped this way.

text: Flying, protection from artifacts
flavor:
"Do not treat your people as you treat your artifacts. Let them go, and they will live; seal them here, and they will die."
—Urza, to Radiant
originalText: Flying, protection from artifacts
name: Angelic Curator

text:
Anthroplasm enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{X}, {T}: Remove all +1/+1 counters from Anthroplasm and put X +1/+1 counters on it.
flavor: I never metamorphosis I didn't like.
originalText:
Anthroplasm comes into play with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{X}, {T}: Remove all +1/+1 counters from Anthroplasm and put X +1/+1 counters on it.
name: Anthroplasm

rulings.text: While Anthroplasm does become 0/0 for a moment while its ability resolves, state-based actions are not checked until the ability has finished resolving. By that time, it will have some +1/+1 counters on it (assuming X was greater than 0), and so will not be put into its owner's graveyard.

text: {T}: Draw a card.
flavor: Some do. Some teach. The rest look it up.
originalText: {T}: Draw a card.
name: Archivist
Aura Flux

rulings.text: If two or more Aura Fluxes are on the battlefield, they will give the text to each other. And they will cause each other enchantment to have two triggered abilities for which the player would have to pay.
This card adds a triggered ability to all other enchantments.
You choose whether to pay {2} or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice the enchantment.

text: Other enchantments have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this enchantment unless you pay {2}."
originalText: Each other enchantment gains "During your upkeep, pay {2} or sacrifice this enchantment."
flavor: To some, the Tolarian sunrise was a blinding flash; to others, a lingering glow.

text:
Haste
Echo {3}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Avalanche Riders enters the battlefield, destroy target land.
originalText:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
Avalanche Riders is unaffected by summoning sickness.
When Avalanche Riders comes into play, destroy target land.
name: Avalanche Riders

text: Beast of Burden's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures on the battlefield.
flavor: "If it is meant to be nothing but a machine," Karn finally asked Jhoira, "why did Urza build it to be like me?"
originalText: Beast of Burden has power and toughness each equal to the total number of creatures in play.
name: Beast of Burden
Blessed Reversal

rulings.text: The creatures are counted on resolution.

text: You gain 3 life for each creature attacking you.
originalText: Gain 3 life for each creature attacking you.
flavor: Even an enemy is a valuable resource.

text:
Protection from blue
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
originalText:
Protection from blue
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)
name: Bloated Toad

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

text:
Flying
Echo {2}{B} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Bone Shredder enters the battlefield, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature.
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
originalText: Flying; echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.) When Bone Shredder comes into play, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature.
name: Bone Shredder

text: Bouncing Beebles can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an artifact.
flavor: Beebles are frequently hurled against stone surfaces at high speed but always zing back into the air with a giggle.
originalText: Bouncing Beebles is unblockable if defending player controls an artifact.
name: Bouncing Beebles
Brink of Madness

rulings.text: The ability only triggers if you have no cards in your hand as your upkeep step begins.

You must sacrifice Brink of Madness if possible, but the opponent discards his or her hand even if you can't sacrifice it for some reason (for example, if it were returned to its owner's hand before the ability resolved).

text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have no cards in hand, sacrifice Brink of Madness and target opponent discards his or her hand.
originalText: During your upkeep, if you have no cards in hand, sacrifice Brink of Madness and target opponent discards his or her hand.
flavor:
"The fools thought me dead. But I built an empire inside my tomb."
—Kerrick, sleeper agent

name: Burst of Energy
text: Untap target permanent.
originalText: Untap target permanent.
flavor:
"I stand ready to die for our world. Who will stand with me?"
—Radiant, archangel

name: Cessation
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack.
When Cessation is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Cessation to its owner's hand.
originalText:
Enchanted creature cannot attack.
When Cessation is put into a graveyard from play, return Cessation to owner's hand.
flavor:
"The face of Light will shine upon them, and they will know war no more."
—Song of All, canto 918

text:
Flying
When Cloud of Faeries enters the battlefield, untap up to two lands.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
originalText:
Flying
When Cloud of Faeries comes into play, untap up to two lands.
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)
name: Cloud of Faeries

rulings.text: You can untap another player's lands.
This does not target the lands.
You can untap 0, 1, or 2 lands.

Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

name: Crawlspace

rulings.text: Your opponents can still attack planeswalkers you control with any number of creatures each combat.

text: No more than two creatures can attack you each combat.
originalText: No more than two creatures can attack you each combat.
flavor: The goblins did not understand their attraction to the mana rig. They simply knew it was where they belonged.

name: Crop Rotation
text:
As an additional cost to cast Crop Rotation, sacrifice a land.
Search your library for a land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
originalText:
At the time you play Crop Rotation, sacrifice a land.
Search your library for a land card and put that land into play. Shuffle your library afterward.
flavor: "Hmm . . . maybe lotuses this year."

name: Damping Engine

rulings.text: A player affected by this card can sacrifice a permanent any time he or she could cast an instant. This is a special action that doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to.

A player can only sacrifice a permanent to end this effect if he or she has more permanents than any other player, and he or she hasn't already sacrificed a permanent to end the effect this turn. The ability to sacrifice a creature is granted by the same effect that is being ended.

text: A player who controls more permanents than each other player can't play lands or cast artifact, creature, or enchantment spells. That player may sacrifice a permanent for that player to ignore this effect until end of turn.
originalText: A player who controls more permanents than any other cannot play lands or artifact, creature, or enchantment spells. That player may sacrifice a permanent to ignore this effect until end of turn.

text:
Protection from black
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
originalText:
Protection from black
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)
name: Darkwatch Elves

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

text:
Flash
Protection from white
flavor: Some knights will not follow orders—only disorder.
originalText:
Protection from white
You may play Defender of Chaos any time you could play an instant.
name: Defender of Chaos

rulings.text: This card is always a creature spell and is never an instant spell, no matter when you cast it.

text:
Flash
Protection from red
flavor: "It is not my place to question Radiant's rule. I exist to enforce her will."
originalText:
Protection from red
You may play Defender of Law any time you could play an instant.
name: Defender of Law

rulings.text: This card is always a creature spell and is never an instant spell, no matter when you cast it.

name: Defense Grid

rulings.text: The additional cost can be reduced by effects that reduce costs, such as Sapphire Medallion.
In Two-Headed Giant, spells don't cost extra on your own turn.

text: Each spell costs {3} more to cast except during its controller's turn.
originalText: During each player's turn, spells played by another player cost an additional {3}.
flavor:
"We've managed to keep the goblins in their assigned areas, but there's little we can do about the smell."
—Whip Tongue, viashino technician

name: Defense of the Heart

rulings.text: In a multiplayer game, it triggers if at least one opponent controls three or more creatures.
You choose how many cards to put onto the battlefield during the resolution after you look through your library. You do not choose as the ability goes on the stack.
This triggered ability only triggers if your opponent controls 3 or more creatures at the beginning of upkeep. This condition is checked again on resolution.
A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.
If this card is not on the battlefield at the time it resolves, then you can't sacrifice it. You still perform the search and put any creature cards you find onto the battlefield.

text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent controls three or more creatures, sacrifice Defense of the Heart, search your library for up to two creature cards, and put those cards onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
originalText: During your upkeep, if one of your opponents controls three or more creatures, sacrifice Defense of the Heart, search your library for up to two creature cards, and put those creatures into play. Shuffle your library afterward.

name: Delusions of Mediocrity
text:
When Delusions of Mediocrity enters the battlefield, you gain 10 life.
When Delusions of Mediocrity leaves the battlefield, you lose 10 life.
originalText:
When Delusions of Mediocrity comes into play, gain 10 life.
When Delusions of Mediocrity leaves play, lose 10 life.
flavor: When nothing but second best will do.

text:
Echo {3}{G}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Deranged Hermit enters the battlefield, put four 1/1 green Squirrel creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Squirrel creatures get +1/+1.
originalText:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
When Deranged Hermit comes into play, put four Squirrel tokens into play. Treat these tokens as 1/1 green creatures.
All Squirrels get +1/+1.
name: Deranged Hermit

rulings.text: The Squirrel tokens get the bonus, so they are effectively 2/2 creatures until the Hermit leaves the battlefield. And they get bigger if multiple Hermits are on the battlefield.

text: {T}: Destroy target Aura attached to a creature.
flavor: The notes themselves are irrelevant. The music's effect, however, is worth ten armies.
originalText: {T}: Destroy target creature enchantment.
name: Devout Harpist

rulings.text: It can only target "Enchantment - Aura" cards, which includes cards changed into Auras, such as Licids.

name: Engineered Plague
text:
As Engineered Plague enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
All creatures of the chosen type get -1/-1.
originalText:
When Engineered Plague comes into play, choose a creature type.
All creatures of the chosen type get -1/-1.
flavor:
"The admixture of bitterwort in the viral brew has produced most favorable results."
—Phyrexian progress notes

name: Erase

rulings.text: The card does not go to the graveyard first.

text: Exile target enchantment.
originalText: Remove target enchantment from the game.
flavor: Perception is more pleasing than truth.

text:
Protection from white
When Eviscerator enters the battlefield, you lose 5 life.
flavor: It roamed the time bubble like a captured animal. Kerrick knew he must soon find a way to unleash it on Tolaria or destroy it.
originalText:
Protection from white
When Eviscerator comes into play, lose 5 life.
name: Eviscerator

rulings.text: This is loss of life, and not damage. It can't be prevented.

text: {T}, Sacrifice Expendable Troops: Expendable Troops deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
flavor: No doubt in their minds, no fear in their hearts.
originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Expendable Troops: Expendable Troops deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
name: Expendable Troops
Faerie Conclave

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

text:
Faerie Conclave enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
{1}{U}: Faerie Conclave becomes a 2/1 blue Faerie creature with flying until end of turn. It's still a land.
originalText:
Faerie Conclave comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add one blue mana to your mana pool.
{1}{U} Faerie Conclave becomes a 2/1 blue creature with flying until end of turn. This creature still counts as a land.

text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{1}{U}: Return Fleeting Image to its owner's hand.
flavor: Horas swore off drinking, but after meeting the creature a second time he decided he'd better start again.
originalText:
Flying
{1}{U} Return Fleeting Image to owner's hand.
name: Fleeting Image

text:
Flying
{B}: Regenerate Fog of Gnats.
flavor: You can swat a thousand gnats, but a thousand more will assail you.
originalText:
Flying
{B} Regenerate Fog of Gnats.
name: Fog of Gnats
Forbidding Watchtower

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

text:
Forbidding Watchtower enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
{1}{W}: Forbidding Watchtower becomes a 1/5 white Soldier creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
originalText:
Forbidding Watchtower comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add one white mana to your mana pool.
{1}{W} Forbidding Watchtower becomes a 1/5 white creature until end of turn. This creature still counts as a land.

name: Frantic Search

rulings.text: You can untap another player's lands.
This does not target the lands.

text: Draw two cards, then discard two cards. Untap up to three lands.
originalText: Draw two cards, then choose and discard two cards. Untap up to three lands.
flavor: Motivation was high in the academy once students realized flunking their exams could kill them.

text: Whenever Gang of Elk becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
flavor: The elk is Gaea's favorite, who wears the forest on its brow.
originalText: Whenever a creature blocks it, Gang of Elk gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
name: Gang of Elk

rulings.text: Gang of Elk gets the bonus once for each blocker.

printings: Premium Deck Series: Fire and Lightning
name: Ghitu Encampment

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

text:
Ghitu Encampment enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
{1}{R}: Ghitu Encampment becomes a 2/1 red Warrior creature with first strike until end of turn. It's still a land. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
originalText:
Ghitu Encampment comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add one red mana to your mana pool.
{1}{R} Ghitu Encampment becomes a 2/1 red creature with first strike until end of turn. This creature still counts as a land.

text: {T}, Sacrifice Ghitu Fire-Eater: Ghitu Fire-Eater deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.

"They are called ‘Mi'uto,' which means ‘one use.'"

text:
Echo {2}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Ghitu Slinger enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)

text: {R}: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
originalText: {R} Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: The war cry is not simply a shout but a sacrament.

name: Giant Cockroach
flavor: If the sun ever hit the swamp, where would these scurry to?

text: Whenever Goblin Medics becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
flavor:
"First, do some harm."
—Oath of Goblins
originalText: Whenever Goblin Medics becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

rulings.text: The ability does trigger when it taps to attack.

text: {T}: Choose target artifact a player controls and target artifact card in that player's graveyard. If both targets are still legal as this ability resolves, that player simultaneously sacrifices the artifact and returns the artifact card to the battlefield.
flavor: "I wrecked your metal guy, boss. But look! I made you an ashtray."
originalText: {T}: Exchange target artifact a player controls for target artifact card in that player's graveyard.
name: Goblin Welder

rulings.text: As the new wording makes clear, both targets must still be legal as the ability resolves in order for it to do anything. If either one or both has become illegal, nothing gets sacrificed and nothing gets returned to the battlefield.

name: Granite Grip
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 for each Mountain you control.
originalText: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 for each mountain you control.
flavor: There's beauty in the desert—but it's best to view it from afar.

name: Grim Monolith
text:
Grim Monolith doesn't untap during your untap step.
{T}: Add {3} to your mana pool.
{4}: Untap Grim Monolith.
originalText:
Grim Monolith does not untap during your untap phase.
{T}: Add three colorless mana to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.
{4}: Untap Grim Monolith.
flavor: Part prison, part home.

name: Harmonic Convergence

rulings.text: If any player needs to put more than one enchantment on top of their library, they choose the order.

text: Put all enchantments on top of their owners' libraries.
originalText: Return all enchantments to top of owners' libraries.
flavor: When the eternal stars align, can mere mortals resist?

name: Hidden Gibbons

rulings.text: When it turns into a creature, it is no longer an enchantment.
It changes into a creature even if the spell is countered.
The ability triggers when the spell is cast, so it becomes a creature before the spell resolves.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

text: When an opponent casts an instant spell, if Hidden Gibbons is an enchantment, Hidden Gibbons becomes a 4/4 Ape creature.
originalText: When one of your opponents successfully casts an instant or interrupt spell, if Hidden Gibbons is an enchantment, Hidden Gibbons becomes a 4/4 creature that counts as an Ape.
flavor: When these apes want something, it's a matter of gibbon take.

name: Hope and Glory

rulings.text: Must target two different creatures.

text: Untap two target creatures. Each of them gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
originalText: Untap two target creatures. Each of them gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Serra ruled by faith. I cannot afford that luxury."
—Radiant, archangel

name: Impending Disaster

rulings.text: This ability does not trigger at all if there are not seven lands on the battlefield at the beginning of upkeep. It checks this number again when it is going to resolve and does not do anything if the land count is below 7.
The ability is not optional.
If this card is not on the battlefield at the times its ability resolves, then you can't sacrifice it. However, you still destroy all lands.

text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are seven or more lands on the battlefield, sacrifice Impending Disaster and destroy all lands.
originalText: During your upkeep, if there are seven or more lands in play, sacrifice Impending Disaster and destroy all lands.
flavor:
"The goblins are in charge of maintenance? Why not just set it on fire now and call it a day?"
—Whip Tongue, viashino technician

name: Intervene

rulings.text: If a spell is modal, use the target(s) of the current mode only for this check. Targets for the other modes are never selected.
Intervene can only target a spell that is currently targeting a creature.
It means "targeting at least one creature" not "exactly one creature".
If the spell's target leaves the battlefield before this spell resolves, Intervene will be countered since it no longer targets a spell that targets a creature.

text: Counter target spell that targets a creature.
originalText: Counter target spell that targets a creature.
flavor:
"At first I simply observed. But I found that without investment in others, life serves no purpose."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Iron Maiden
text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Iron Maiden deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of cards in his or her hand minus 4.
originalText: During each of your opponent's upkeeps, Iron Maiden deals 1 damage to that player for each card more than four in his or her hand.
flavor: The maiden is a jealous lover.

name: Iron Will

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

Target creature gets +0/+4 until end of turn.

text: {2}: Regenerate target artifact creature.
originalText: {2}: Regenerate target artifact creature.
flavor: It entertained Jhoira to craft a kit that could bring her the tools.

Flying, protection from black
Echo {3}{W}{W} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Karmic Guide enters the battlefield, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

text: {1}{U}, {T}: Put target green creature on top of its owner's library.

"I'm allergic to shellfish—not only did it kill my entire village, it also gave me this nasty rash."
—Olivia, fisher

Knighthood
text: Creatures you control have first strike.
originalText: All creatures you control gain first strike.
flavor:
"He has returned. He who brought the dark ones. He who poisoned our paradise. How shall we greet him? With swift and certain death!"
—Radiant, archangel

name: Last-Ditch Effort

rulings.text: The creatures are chosen and sacrificed on resolution.
It deals one damage for each creature sacrificed.

text: Sacrifice any number of creatures. Last-Ditch Effort deals that much damage to target creature or player.
originalText: Sacrifice X creatures. Last-Ditch Effort deals X damage to target creature or player.
flavor:
"If you're gonna lose, at least make sure they don't win as much."
—Jula, goblin raider

name: Lava Axe
text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.
originalText: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.
flavor: "Catch!"

name: Levitation
text: Creatures you control have flying.
originalText: All creatures you control gain flying.
flavor: Barrin's pride in his apprentice was diminished somewhat when he had to get the others back down.

text: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
flavor: A wolf without a pack is either a survivor or a brute.
originalText: You may have Lone Wolf deal combat damage to defending player instead of to creatures blocking it.
name: Lone Wolf

rulings.text: If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

name: Lurking Skirge

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

text: When a creature is put into an opponent's graveyard from the battlefield, if Lurking Skirge is an enchantment, Lurking Skirge becomes a 3/2 Imp creature with flying.
originalText: When a creature is put into one of your opponents' graveyards, if Lurking Skirge is an enchantment, Lurking Skirge becomes a 3/2 creature with flying that counts as an Imp.
flavor: They never miss a funeral.

name: Martyr's Cause
text: Sacrifice a creature: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature or player this turn, prevent that damage.
originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Prevent all damage to a creature or player from one source. (Treat further damage from that source normally.)
flavor: Dying is a soldier's talent.

name: Memory Jar

rulings.text: You can't look at the cards you exiled until they return to your hand.

text: {T}, Sacrifice Memory Jar: Each player exiles all cards from his or her hand face down and draws seven cards. At the beginning of the next end step, each player discards his or her hand and returns to his or her hand each card he or she exiled this way.
originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Memory Jar: Each player sets aside his or her hand, face down, and draws seven cards. At end of turn, each player discards his or her hand and returns to his or her hand each card he or she set aside this way.

name: Might of Oaks
text: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
originalText: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
flavor: Suddenly, she couldn't see the acorns for the trees.

name: Miscalculation

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

text:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2}.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
originalText:
Counter target spell unless its caster pays an additional {2}.
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

text:
{1}{R}{R}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Molten Hydra.
{T}, Remove all +1/+1 counters from Molten Hydra: Molten Hydra deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of +1/+1 counters removed this way.
flavor: Keep off the glass. —Hydra warning sign
originalText:
{1}{R}{R} Put a +1/+1 counter on Molten Hydra.
{T}, Remove all +1/+1 counters from Molten Hydra: Molten Hydra deals 1 damage to target creature or player for each +1/+1 counter removed this way.
name: Molten Hydra

text: {T}: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
flavor: "My family protects all families."
originalText: {T}: Target creature you control gains protection from a color of your choice until end of turn.
name: Mother of Runes
Multani's Acolyte
text:
Echo {G}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Multani's Acolyte enters the battlefield, draw a card.
originalText:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
When Multani's Acolyte comes into play, draw a card.

name: Multani's Presence

rulings.text: Will trigger when a spell is countered due to all of its targets being illegal.

text: Whenever a spell you've cast is countered, draw a card.
originalText: Whenever a spell you play is countered, draw a card.
flavor: When a tree falls in the forest, Multani hears it.

text:
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Multani, Maro-Sorcerer's power and toughness are each equal to the total number of cards in all players' hands.
flavor:
"To make peace with the forest, make peace with me."
—Multani, to Urza
originalText:
Multani, Maro-Sorcerer has power and toughness each equal to the total number of cards in all players' hands.
Multani cannot be the target of spells or abilities.
name: Multani, Maro-Sorcerer
No Mercy

rulings.text: If the damage to you is all prevented or redirected, then damage was not dealt to you, and this does not trigger.

text: Whenever a creature deals damage to you, destroy it.
originalText: Whenever a creature successfully deals damage to you, destroy it.
flavor:
"We had years to prepare, while they had mere minutes."
—Kerrick, sleeper agent

name: Opal Avenger

rulings.text: When it turns into a creature, it is no longer an enchantment.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

text: When you have 10 or less life, if Opal Avenger is an enchantment, Opal Avenger becomes a 3/5 Soldier creature.
originalText: When you have 10 life or less, if Opal Avenger is an enchantment, Opal Avenger becomes a 3/5 creature that counts as a Guardian.
flavor: As the sun grew cold in the realm, the statue grew warm.

name: Opal Champion

rulings.text: It triggers when the spell is cast, so it becomes a creature before the spell resolves. A creature that would destroy an enchantment when it enters the battlefield can't be used to destroy this card, since it will no longer be an enchantment when the creature enters the battlefield.
When it turns into a creature, it is no longer an enchantment.
It changes into a creature even if the spell is countered.
A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

text: When an opponent casts a creature spell, if Opal Champion is an enchantment, Opal Champion becomes a 3/3 Knight creature with first strike.
originalText: When one of your opponents successfully casts a creature spell, if Opal Champion is an enchantment, Opal Champion becomes a 3/3 creature with first strike that counts as a Knight.

name: Opportunity
text: Target player draws four cards.
originalText: Target player draws four cards.
flavor:
"He cocooned himself alone in his workshop for months. When he finally emerged, all broad grins and excited chatter, I knew he'd found his answer."
—Barrin, master wizard

name: Ostracize

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a creature card from it. That player discards that card.
originalText: Look at target opponent's hand and choose a creature card there. That player discards that card.
flavor: Kerrick was to find that some borders can never be crossed.

Flying

text: {1}{B}, Pay 2 life: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
originalText: {1}{B}, Pay 2 life: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

Planar Collapse

rulings.text: This ability does not trigger at all if there are not 4 or more creatures on the battlefield. It also checks this at the start of resolution and does nothing if this is not still true.
The ability is not optional.
If this card is not on the battlefield when the ability resolves, then you can't sacrifice it. However, you still destroy all creatures.

text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are four or more creatures on the battlefield, sacrifice Planar Collapse and destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.
originalText: During your upkeep, if there are four or more creatures in play, sacrifice Planar Collapse and destroy all creatures. Those creatures cannot be regenerated this turn.
flavor: With heavy heart, Urza doused one world's light to rekindle another's.

name: Purify
text: Destroy all artifacts and enchantments.
originalText: Destroy all artifacts and enchantments.
flavor:
"Our Mother! The sky was Her hair; the sun, Her face. She danced on the grass and in the hills."
—Song of All, canto 23

rulings.text: If the target of Rancor when it's cast as a spell is an illegal target when Rancor tries to resolve, Rancor will be countered and put into its owner's graveyard. It won't return to its owner's hand.

text: When Rank and File enters the battlefield, green creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: The -1/-1 penalty is given to all green creatures on the battlefield when the triggered ability resolves. It will not apply to green creatures that enter the battlefield later in the turn.

Flying

Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

text:

name: Rivalry

rulings.text: This ability will only trigger if the player controls more lands at the beginning of upkeep. This condition is checked again at the start of resolution, and if not true, then nothing happens.

text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, if that player controls more lands than each other player, Rivalry deals 2 damage to him or her.
originalText: During each player's upkeep, if that player controls more lands than any other, Rivalry deals 2 damage to him or her.
flavor: The goblins revered it; the viashino defended it. Only Urza understood it.

name: Scrapheap
text: Whenever an artifact or enchantment is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
originalText: Whenever an artifact or enchantment is put into your graveyard from play, gain 1 life.
flavor: Junk heaps have rats, but scrapheaps have goblins.

name: Second Chance

rulings.text: It is not optional.
The ability will only trigger if you have 5 or less life at the beginning of upkeep. This is checked again at the start of resolution and nothing happens if you do not still have 5 or less life.
If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

On resolution of the trigger you have to sacrifice this card if you have 5 life or less. If you can't (because it is not on the battlefield, for example), then you still take an extra turn after this one.

text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have 5 or less life, sacrifice Second Chance and take an extra turn after this one.
originalText: During your upkeep, if you have 5 life or less, sacrifice Second Chance and take an extra turn after this one.
flavor: The greatest gift is the opportunity to right one's wrongs.

text:
Flying
When Shivan Phoenix dies, return Shivan Phoenix to its owner's hand.

Flying
When Shivan Phoenix is put into a graveyard from play, return Shivan Phoenix to owner's hand.

originalText: Two target creatures each get -1/-1 until end of turn.

name: Silk Net

rulings.text: Both the +1/+1 and reach only last until end of turn.
This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

text: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains reach until end of turn. (It can block creatures with flying.)
originalText: Target creature gets +1/+1 and can block creatures with flying until end of turn.

name: Snap

rulings.text: You can untap another player's lands.

text: Return target creature to its owner's hand. Untap up to two lands.
originalText: Return target creature to owner's hand. Untap up to two lands.
flavor: Good riddance.

name: Spawning Pool

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

text:
Spawning Pool enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
{1}{B}: Spawning Pool becomes a 1/1 black Skeleton creature with "{B}: Regenerate this creature" until end of turn. It's still a land. (If it regenerates, the next time it would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
originalText:
Spawning Pool comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add one black mana to your mana pool.
{1}{B} Spawning Pool becomes a 1/1 black creature with "{B} Regenerate this creature" until end of turn. This creature still counts as a land.

name: Subversion

rulings.text: This is loss of life, not damage. It can't be prevented.

name: Tinker

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

text:
As an additional cost to cast Tinker, sacrifice an artifact.
Search your library for an artifact card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
originalText:
At the time you play Tinker, sacrifice an artifact.
Search your library for an artifact card and put that artifact into play. Shuffle your library afterward.
flavor:
"I wonder how it feels to be bored."
—Jhoira, artificer

text: {T}, Sacrifice Tragic Poet: Return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.

Treacherous Link
text:
Enchant creature
All damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature is dealt to its controller instead.
originalText: Redirect to its controller all damage dealt to enchanted creature.
flavor:
"You cannot possibly know the toll your alliances will exact from you."
—Barrin, to Urza

text: Whenever Treefolk Mystic blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, destroy all Auras attached to that creature.
flavor: Urza's wards fell from him like autumn leaves as he entered the dreaming grove. He awoke imprisoned in living wood.
originalText: Whenever a creature blocks or is blocked by Treefolk Mystic, destroy all enchantments on that creature.
name: Treefolk Mystic
Treetop Village

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

text:
Treetop Village enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{1}{G}: Treetop Village becomes a 3/3 green Ape creature with trample until end of turn. It's still a land. (If it would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
originalText:
Treetop Village comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add one green mana to your mana pool.
{1}{G} Treetop Village becomes a 3/3 green creature with trample until end of turn. This creature still counts as a land.

name: Unearth

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

text:
Return target creature card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
originalText:
Choose target creature card in your graveyard with total casting cost 3 or less and put that creature into play.
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)
